title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:29 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
00:38 <+abusenius> hi @all  
00:38 <+abusenius> anyone awake?  
00:39 <+abusenius> what is the current policy for working with git wrt. branches and pull requests?  
00:40 <+abusenius> say, I want to make a proposal and I have a bunch of commits that implement it  
00:40 <+abusenius> where should I put them so that everyone can take a look?  
00:40 <+abusenius> into a branch on xwiki/xwiki-\* ?  
00:41 <+abusenius> (1)  
00:41 <+abusenius> or (2) into my fork of xwiki-\* repo and do a pull request  
00:42 <+abusenius> or (3) into a branch in my fork of xwiki-\* repo and just give a link in mail  
00:42 <+abusenius> or something else?  
00:42 <@sdumitriu> Hi abusenius  
00:42 <+abusenius> hi  
00:42 <@sdumitriu> Me awake  
00:42 <@sdumitriu> Since you're a committer, the best thing is 1  
00:43 <@sdumitriu> Did I cause https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/bf513e70ed7dc88604a025f499137c549068760a ?  
00:44 <+abusenius> yes, I guess you've missed that change  
00:44 <+abusenius> the same thing for groups was ok  
00:45 <+abusenius> thats why we need to test with csrf protection enabled :)  
00:46 <@sdumitriu> About CSRF tokens and redirect URLs, isn't it dangerous to include tokens in URLs?  
00:46 <@sdumitriu> Can't an attacker open in an iframe a document that redirects, and read the resulting URL?  
00:47 <+abusenius> well, yes, it can be used to read the token, also with some tricks from browsing history  
00:47 <+abusenius> but sometimes it is hard to avoid  
00:48 <+abusenius> for example if we have a link that deletes something  
00:49 <+abusenius> also, we should not have a way to automatically add a token and redirect  
00:49 <+abusenius> it would be a hole  
00:51 <+abusenius> I pass the token parameter from the URL in cases where redirect is needed  
00:58 <cjdelisle> has quit

09:54 <developer> Hi everybody, is XWiki Enterprise 3.0 Java 1.5 or 1.6?  
10:02 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <developer> Hello do i need Java 5 or Java 6 for XWiki Enterprise 3.0  
10:08 <+sburjan> developer: you should use Java 5. If you use 3.1 you should user Java 1.6  
10:12 <developer> Thank you

11:02 <+mflorea> jvdrean: do you know why I can't use macros defined in a velocity template that is included in a wiki page with #template('someTemplateDefiningAMacro.vm')?  
11:13 <sburjan> has quit  
11:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <+mflorea> tmortagne: do you know why I can't use macros defined in a velocity template that is included in a wiki page with #template('someTemplateDefiningAMacro.vm')?  
11:33 <+tmortagne> mflorea: not sure but I guess it means #template is registering macro in a different velocity namespace  
11:33 <+mflorea> :(  
11:33 <+tmortagne> but could not say if that's done on purpose or not  
11:34 <+tmortagne> also I guess it mean macro.vm are not handled the same way  
11:40 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
11:40 <+jvelociter> hi guys  
11:40 <+jvelociter> I have an error building trunk of XE  
11:40 <+jvelociter> POM Location: /Users/jerome/repos/xwiki-enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-web/pom.xml  
11:40 <+jvelociter> Validation Messages:  
11:40 <+jvelociter>     [0]  'dependencies.dependency.version' is missing for ch.qos.logback:logback-classic:jar  
11:40 <+jvelociter> known ?  
11:41 <+tmortagne> master ?  
11:42 <+tmortagne> the version of logback is supposed to be in the root pom.xml so that's weird you have this error  
11:42 <+tmortagne> by trunk you mean git master right ? you are not trying to build what's on svn ? ;)  
11:43 <JonasBausch> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <JonasBausch> hey guys, just one question  
11:43 <JonasBausch> is it possible to give acces rights on section level of a xwiki-page  
11:44 <JonasBausch> like, when creating a document, the first chapter/section is public, but the second one is still in progress so I don't want everybody to view it, i deny access to public  
11:45 <+tmortagne> JonasBausch: the direct answer to your question is no  
11:45 <+tmortagne> but  
11:45 <+tmortagne> what you could do it's actually getting each sections from other page using include macro  
11:45 <+tmortagne> and your your right configurations on theses included pages  
11:46 <+tmortagne> include macro is checking page right before included it  
11:46 <JonasBausch> do i get you right, that i make a document out of each section, so one big document is separated in many documents, which are shown as sections?  
11:47 <+tmortagne> JonasBausch: yep  
11:47 <JonasBausch> but then it would be difficult to publish them as one single document or export it to pdf, right?  
11:48 <+tmortagne> no really no, it's a bit of a pain to edit it from main document but you can use {{include}} macro in your single document and it will be well supported by display and pdf export  
11:49 <JonasBausch> the problem is, that future users of my xwiki are DAUs, they won't use it if it's too complicated^^  
11:49 <JonasBausch> the best would be a dropdownlist on each section, where the user can give access-rights  
11:50 <+tmortagne> problem is that there is no way at platform level to associate right to sections  
11:51 <JonasBausch> yeah, the problem is, that sections aren't actual objects, they're just formatted richtext  
11:52 <+tmortagne> include macro is easy to use but it's a lot more painfull to setup right for all document merge into one than having a UI to directly associate right on sections  
11:52 <+tmortagne> yep  
11:53 <+tmortagne> now you could always write a right UI which is taking into account include macro found in the document and present it like if it was right associated to section ;)  
11:53 <JonasBausch> alright, thank you for the answer, I'll check that with my customer, if this function is mandatory  
11:53 <+tmortagne> but that's a bit of work  
11:53 <JonasBausch> have a nice day  
11:53 <+tmortagne> JonasBausch: you'r welcome  
11:55 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: yes master  
11:55 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: sorry for the joke  
11:56 <+tmortagne> but I don't have much idea, as I sayf the version is supposed to be in the root commons pom.xml  
11:56 <JonasBausch> has quit  
11:58 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: I'll try building commons master  
11:58 <+jvelociter> now I feel like talking to a sensei  
11:58 <+jvelociter> :)  
11:59 <+tmortagne> :D  
12:14 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: works after building xwiki-commons-pom locally  
12:14 <+jvelociter> master  
12:15 <+tmortagne> that's weird it should have downloaded it  
12:15 <+jvelociter> yep it's odd  
12:15 <+jvelociter> I think it's the second time this happen to me  
12:15 <+jvelociter> having to build commons-pom locallhy  
12:22 <+tmortagne> maven 3.0.3 ?  
12:22 <+tmortagne> ( jvelociter )  
12:24 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: ah no, still m2  
12:24 <+jvelociter> that's probably why  
12:25 <+tmortagne> maybe even if that should work with m2 too but never know...  
12:25 <+tmortagne> in any case maven 3 is much better  
12:25 <+tmortagne> and that was is used by our ci  
12:25 <+tmortagne> s/was/what/  
12:28 <+evalica> incubator.myxwiki.org is down  
12:43 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki

12:50 <+tmortagne> mflorea: jvdrean is refering to the tree in document index, looks like he found a bug when the js is <I don't know what this thing is doing> by yui but work in debug mode  
12:52 <+mflorea> tmortagne: but the tree in document index (Main.AllDocs) is based on xwikiexplorer.js (SmartClient, not yui) and it displayed document titles for me  
12:54 <+tmortagne> mflorea: i'm talking about yui compressor  
12:54 <+mflorea> I see  
12:54 <+tmortagne> the thing which is imrpoving/whatever the js when releasing  
12:54 <+tmortagne> looks like it does not support some trucky js syntax  
12:55 <+tmortagne> but jvdrean will explain it better than me when he come back  
12:55 <+mflorea> yes, but the issue summary is misleading  
12:55 <+tmortagne> yep  
12:55 <+mflorea> and doesn't have a description :)  
12:58 <+jvdrean> adding a description :)  
12:58 <mflorea> has quit  
13:03 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:13 <siert> has joined #xwiki  
13:13 <siert> he guys, I'm posting pages to xwiki via RESTful; is it possible to post XML between {{code language="xml"}} blocks aswell?  
13:20 <+Enygma`> Hi Guys. I seem to be unable to override macros.vm by attaching it to the current skin. It only works if I replace the template in the WEB-INF folder. Is this a known issue or expected behavior?  
13:21 <+Enygma`> other template overrides work by attaching to the skin, only macros.vm seems to be problematic.  
13:22 <+Enygma`> XWiki 3.0  
13:28 <+Enygma`> ok, it seems that macros.vm is special and is not overriddable from Skins.  
13:36 <+evalica> incubator.myxwiki.org is down  
13:38 <cjdelisle> has quit  
13:40 <siert> I want to post the following line through RESTful in a Wiki page: 'className=TagClass&property#tags=foo,bar' -> how can I escape the & ?  
13:42 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:51 <siert> got it; have to use the XML escape sequences...  
13:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: is there a way to reuse in a wiki page velocity macros defined in a template?  
14:13 <+jvdrean> mflorea: I can't reproduce, I thought I had spotted this with asyd recently but I was wrong  
14:13 <+jvdrean> (http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6774)
